text: Antonio Esparragoza Betancourt (born September 2, 1959) is the former WBA Featherweight Champion of the World, from Venezuela. == Amateur career == Esparragoza represented Venezuela as a Featherweight at the 1980 Moscow Olympic Games. Below are the results from that tournament: * Round of 64: bye * Round of 32: lost to Peter Hanlon (Great Britain) by decision, 1-4 == Professional career == Esparragoza turned pro in 1981 and after largely fighting unproven fighters in his native Venezuela was granted a shot at Lineal & WBA Featherweight Titles holder Steve Cruz in 1987. Esparragoza pulled off an upset with a TKO in the 12th round. Esparragoza defended the titles against seven contenders before losing the belts to Yong-Kyun Park in 1991 via unanimous decision. He retired after the loss.
